summary: This is a motion filed by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys in a civil case (15-cv-07433-RWS) in the Southern District of New York. The motion seeks to compel the plaintiff (an unnamed alleged victim) to disclose information about alleged ongoing criminal investigations involving Maxwell, or, alternatively, to stay the civil proceedings. The defense argues the plaintiff has repeatedly referenced such investigations but refuses to provide details, and that Assistant U.S. Attorney A. Marie Villafana stated she was unaware of any such investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the civil case. Her attorneys are filing this motion to compel discovery or stay proceedings, arguing she is unaware of any ongoing criminal investigation against her.

persons.name: Laura A. Menninger
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, signatory on the motion from the firm Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, signatory on the motion from the firm Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C.

persons.name: A. Marie Villafana
persons.context: Government lawyer handling the VRA litigation. Defense counsel contacted her, and she stated she was unaware of any ongoing criminal investigation regarding Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Sigrid S. McCawley
persons.context: Attorney for the plaintiff, served with this motion. Works for Boies, Schiller & Flexner, LLP.

persons.name: Nicole Simmons
persons.context: Person who certified service of this motion.

connections.description: Menninger is listed as defense counsel for Maxwell in this civil case.
Pagliuca is listed as defense counsel for Maxwell in this civil case.
Both are attorneys from Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. representing Ghislaine Maxwell.
Villafana is a government attorney whom Maxwell's counsel contacted regarding a potential investigation; she stated she was unaware of any investigation involving Maxwell.

events.title: Filing of Motion to Compel/Stay
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys file a motion to compel the plaintiff to disclose alleged ongoing criminal investigations or to stay the civil proceedings.

locations: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT SOUTHERN DISTRICT OF NEW YORK
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team asserts the plaintiff (an alleged victim) has repeatedly claimed knowledge of an ongoing criminal investigation involving Maxwell but refuses to provide details, claiming privilege.
Defense counsel contacted AUSA A. Marie Villafana, who stated she was unaware of any such criminal investigation regarding Ghislaine Maxwell.

The motion argues that if the plaintiff continues to withhold information about alleged investigations, the civil proceedings should be stayed to protect Maxwell's rights, including her Fifth Amendment privilege.
The underlying civil allegations involve claims that Maxwell assisted in 'trafficking' the plaintiff from approximately 1999 to 2001.
The document is a strategic legal move from April 2016, attempting to force disclosure or delay a civil case, predating Maxwell's later federal indictment and arrest.
